title: Sam Burgess forced into early retirement due to chronic shoulder injury
text:
Sam Burgess, universally regarded as one of the greatest rugby league players of all time, has been forced into early retirement due to a chronic shoulder condition.

The South Sydney Rabbitohs forward, who rose to prominence as a teenager at Bradford Bulls and also had an ill-fated stint in rugby union with Bath, representing England at the 2015 World Cup, has hung up his boots on medical advice.

The announcement brings to an end a distinguished career which saw the 30 year-old win the NRL title with Souths in 2014 as he came to be recognised and respected as one of the world's finest rugby talents.

Burgess hurt his left shoulder early in the Rabbitohs’ season and later developed an infection after routine surgery on the injury.

“This decision was one of the hardest decisions I’ve had to make in my life, however the decision was out of my hands essentially,” said Burgess.
description: Sam Burgess, universally regarded as one of the greatest rugby league players of all time, has been forced into early retirement due to a chronic shoulder condition.
